description.narrative: (Uganda): .The Regional Health Integration to Enhance Services in North-Acholi (RHITES-Acholi) activity supports 331 maternal, neonatal and child health (MNCH) sites and 83 TB management units in 8 districts. RHITES will support implementation of a district-based, integrated package of quality maternal and child health, HIV/AIDS, TB, nutrition, and WASH interventions in targeted districts. Three main areas will be prioritized: scaling-up and strengthening implementation of the high impact evidence based packages; strengthening community level interventions to increase demand and uptake of MNCH services; and strengthening the health system to improve MNCH services. .Major activities include: capacity building through on-the-job training and mentorship; promoting evidence-based decision-making at district, facility and community level; leveraging other health and non-health platforms to increase coverage and diversify audiences, particularly targeting young people and women groups; strengthening supply chain management at facility level for effective use of commodities; and improving quality of care through application of continuous quality improvement approaches to improve health outcomes and patient safety. RHITES will support communities to identify and address structural, social and patient-related barriers to seeking health care. The activity will engage key stakeholders including religious and cultural leaders to create a supportive and enabling environment for quality health care services and support better health seeking behavior of the targeted population. RHITES will further self-reliance in the region through its district-based approach and meaningful engagement of all stakeholders and beneficiaries. These two approaches will support communities to identify, plan, finance (where possible) and implement their own local solutions to their health challenges... .

title.narrative: Regional Health Integration to Enhance Services in North Acholi (RHITES-NA)
